And so Sara and I furthered our relationship.%K%P
After a couple of our little practice sessions,\nthe two of us started kissing whenever we met.%K%P
'*Smooch*'%K%P
Her kisses always came so suddenly.%K%P
It was just on the cheek, but still.%K%P
'Heehee, I did it again!'%K%P
'Hey, let's be a little more serious, okay?'%K%P
'Oh? A kiss on the cheek isn't good enough?'%K%P
'Fine, my turn next.'%K%P
'Ahn!'%K%P
Even though I started with a playful sort of kiss,\nonce we locked lips things always got real.%K%P
The way the two of us behaved,\nwe must have really looked like lovers.%K%P
But I wasn't used to all this, and Sara had no idea,\nso we were always so worried we were doing it wrong.%K%P
'There's something I've been wanting to ask you.'%K%P
'Be honest with me, how do you feel about us?'%K%P
I'm sure other couples don't ask these things.%K%P
But the way she went on about not knowing love,\nI didn't think we were like other couples.%K%P
'How do I feel... About you? Hmm...'%K%P
'Well, I mean, all of this is pretty fun.\nBut to be honest, I still don't really get it.'%K%P
'I always kind of thought of you as a brother,\nso I've always liked you, and I guess this just\nstems from that.'%K%P
'When we touch and kiss, it's definitely exhilarating\nbut I don't really know if THIS is what love is.'%K%P
'I see...'%K%P
'I'm sorry.'%K%P
She said as she gave a sincere apology.%K%P
Well, at least she had feelings for me.\nIn fact, she seemed to really like me.\nAnd I liked her.%K%P
But were we really in love?\nEven I didn't know.%K%P
'Maybe we aren't all the way in love yet...'%K%P
The words just poured out of me.%K%P
It wasn't something I meant for her to hear,\nbut she heard it nonetheless.%K%P
'You haven't done anything wrong.\nIt's all my fault...'%K%P
'I'm the one who said I'd teach you though,\nit's just not going well.'%K%P
I became her boyfriend, we kissed,\nand I was so happy.%K%P
But she still didn't have her singing voice back.%K%P
I felt so frustrated with myself.%K%P
'No, it's not like that. I don't really\nknow what words to use to explain it...'%K%P
Her words were all I needed to hear\nbefore I realized.%K%P
There was something more powerful than just words.\nAnd I knew quite well what it was.%K%P
'If you can't say it, then sing it to me.'%K%P
'Yamato...'%K%P
She still couldn't sing.\nI knew that, and she knew that I knew.%K%P
'Songs help express the feelings\nwe can't describe with words.'%K%P
'Right?'%K%P
'Yeah. But...'%K%P
She sounded like she was ready to give up,\nbut she cut herself short.%K%P
She sat quietly, letting herself dwell on it.%K%P
'You're right... If I can't say it,\nI should just sing it.'%K%P
'A song that has all of my feelings poured into it.'%K%P
Love, affection, these words are too simple, really.%K%P
Trying to lump everything together wasn't effective.%K%P
'I realized something.\nOur feelings can't fit into a simple word.'%K%P
'Maybe that's why we have songs?'%K%P
'I think so, yeah.'%K%P
She had been singing as a Divine Idol\nfor the past year.%K%P
But was she really singing her own songs?%K%P
'Back in Lâ˜†SEVEN, I just sang whatever they gave us.\nThey were good songs, but they weren't MY songs.'%K%P
'What could I even hope to learn from them?\nAnd did the message ever make it to the fans?'%K%P
'I guess I never really got it.\nAnd I wasn't even able to realize that much.'%K%P
I assumed that love was at least part of 'it'.%K%P
But there were also all sorts of emotions mixed in.%K%P
The real job of a singer is to find those emotions\nand make them known to the audience.%K%P
'I think I want to write a song.'%K%P
'A song for you, Yamato.\nAbout how I feel about you.'%K%P
'I'll always be waiting for your songs.'%K%P
Was it going to be a love song? Or something else?%K%P
How would she express our relationship?\nI was excited just thinking about it.%K%P
'And what are you smiling for, Yamato?'%K%P
'I'm just really excited about it.\nI can't help but smile.'%K%P
'What a coincidence! Me too!'%K%P
She smiled the most dazzling smile as she spoke.%K%P
